class baserowapi.models.field.BaseDateField(name: str, field_data: Dict[str, Any])

Bases: Field

Represents a base date field in Baserow.

Variables:

TYPE (str) – The type of the field, which is ‘base_date’.

TYPE = 'base_date'
validate_value(value: str) → None

Validate the date or datetime value based on the field’s attributes.

Parameters:

value (str) – The date or datetime value to be validated.

Raises:

ValueError – If the value doesn’t match the expected format.

class baserowapi.models.field.Field(name: str, field_data: Dict[str, Any])

Bases: object

Represents a field in Baserow and provides methods to interact with its properties.

format_for_api(value: Any) → Any

Format the value for API submission.

Child classes can override for custom formatting.

Parameters:

value (Any) – The value to be formatted.

Returns:

The formatted value.

Return type:

Any

property id: int | None

Retrieve the ID of the field.

Returns:

The ID of the field or None if not present.

Return type:

Union[int, None]

property is_primary: bool

Determine if the field is primary.

Returns:

True if the field is primary, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

property is_read_only: bool

Determine if the field is read-only.

Returns:

True if the field is read-only, otherwise False.

Return type:

bool

property order: int | None

Retrieve the order of the field.

Returns:

The order of the field or None if not present.

Return type:

Union[int, None]

property table_id: int | None

Retrieve the table ID associated with the field.

Returns:

The table ID or None if not present.

Return type:

Union[int, None]

property type: str | None

Retrieve the type of the field.

Returns:

The type of the field or None if not present.

Return type:

Union[str, None]

validate_value(value: Any) → None

Validate the value against the field’s criteria.

Child classes can override for custom rules.

Parameters:

value (Any) – The value to be validated.

Formats the values for API submission.

Returns:

A list of ids of the matching options for API submission.

Return type:

List[Union[int, str]]

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided values list contains a value that doesn’t match any select option.

Retrieve a list of select option values from the field_data.

List of select option values.

List[str]

class baserowapi.models.field.PhoneNumberField(name: str, field_data: Dict[str, Any])

Bases: Field

Represents a phone number field in Baserow.

Variables:

TYPE (str) – The type of the field, which is ‘phone_number’.

TYPE = 'phone_number'
property compatible_filters: List[str]

Get the list of compatible filters for this PhoneNumberField.

Returns:

The list of compatible filters.

Return type:

List[str]

format_for_api(value: str) → str

Format the value for API submission.

For PhoneNumberField, it would return the phone number as-is after validation.

Parameters:

value (str) – The phone number string to be formatted.

Returns:

The formatted phone number.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the phone number doesn’t match the expected format.

validate_value(value: str) → None

Validate the value for a PhoneNumberField.

Phone numbers can have a maximum length of 100 characters consisting solely of digits, spaces, and the characters: Nx,._+*()#=;/-.

Parameters:

value (str) – The phone number string to be validated.

Raises:

ValueError – If the phone number doesn’t match the expected format.

baserowapi.models.filter module

class baserowapi.models.filter.Filter(field_name, value, operator='equal')

Bases: object

Represents a filter expression used to filter results when fetching rows from a table.

Attributes: - field_name (str): The name of the field to apply the filter on. - value (str, int, etc.): The value to compare against using the operator. - operator (str): The comparison operator. Default is “equal”.

Properties: - query_string (str): Computes the API’s required GET parameter string.

property query_string

Returns the filter as a query string formatted for use as a GET parameter in an API call.

Format: filter__<encoded_field_name>__<operator>=<encoded_value>

baserowapi.models.row module

class baserowapi.models.row.Row(row_data: Dict[str, Any], table: Table, client: Client)

Bases: object

Represents a row in a Baserow table. Provides methods to update and delete the row.

property content: Dict[str, Any]

Get the dictionary representation of the row’s values derived from RowValue objects.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the row’s values.

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

delete() → bool

Deletes the row from the table using the Baserow delete endpoint.

Returns:

True if deletion was successful.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • ValueError – If an unexpected status code is received.

  • Exception – For other errors during the delete operation.

logger: Logger = <Logger baserowapi.models.row (WARNING)>
move(before_id: int | None = None) → Row

Moves the current row to a position before the row specified by before_id.

Parameters:

before_id (Optional[int]) – The ID of the row before which the current row should be moved. If not specified, the row will be moved to the last position. Defaults to None.

Returns:

A Row object representing the updated row.

Return type:

Row

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error during the move operation.

update(values: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, memory_only: bool = False) → Row

Updates the row in the table.

Parameters:

  • values (Optional[Dict[str, Any]]) – A dictionary containing the field values for updating the row. Defaults to values from self.values property.

  • memory_only (bool) – If True, only updates the in-memory row and skips the API request. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A Row object representing the updated row.

Return type:

Row

Raises:

  • KeyError – If the specified field name is not found in the row.

  • Exception – If the API request results in any error responses.

property values: RowValueList

Property to retrieve the RowValueList for this row. If the RowValueList hasn’t been created yet, this property lazily loads it using the stored row data.

Returns:

The RowValueList representing the values for this row.

Return type:

RowValueList

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an error while creating the RowValueList.

baserowapi.models.row_value module

class baserowapi.models.row_value.BaseDateRowValue(field: BaseDateField, raw_value: str | None = None, client: Any | None = None)

Bases: RowValue

Represents a RowValue specifically designed for a BaseDateField.

Attributes:

field (BaseDateField): The associated BaseDateField object. raw_value (Optional[str]): The raw date value as fetched/returned from the API, typically in ISO format. client (Optional[Any]): The Baserow class API client. Some RowValue subclasses may require access to the API.

as_datetime() → datetime

Convert and return the value as a Python datetime object.

Returns:

The value as a datetime object.

Raises:

Exception – If the conversion from ISO format to datetime fails.

property formatted_date: str

Convert the field’s value to a formatted string based on the field’s settings.

The method formats the date and time based on field settings such as date_format, date_time_format, and date_show_tzinfo.

Returns:

The formatted representation of the date or datetime.

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If the value doesn’t match the expected format.

property value: str

Get the value in ISO format.

Returns:

The value in ISO format.

class baserowapi.models.row_value.BooleanRowValue(field: BooleanField, raw_value: bool | None = None, client: Any | None = None)

Bases: RowValue

Represents a RowValue specifically designed for a BooleanField.

Attributes:

field (BooleanField): The associated BooleanField object. raw_value (Optional[bool]): The raw boolean value as fetched/returned from the API. client (Optional[Any]): The Baserow class API client. Some RowValue subclasses may require access to the API.

property value: bool

Get the value in a user-friendly format. For BooleanRowValue, this returns the raw value as a boolean.

Returns:

The boolean value of the raw_value.

class baserowapi.models.row_value.CountRowValue(field: CountField, raw_value: Any | None = None, client: Any | None = None)

Bases: RowValue

Represents a RowValue designed for a CountField.

Parameters:

  • field (CountField) – The associated CountField object.

  • raw_value (Optional[Any], optional) – The raw value as fetched/returned from the API, representing the main (primary) field text values of the linked rows. Defaults to None.

  • client (Optional[Any], optional) – The Baserow class API client. Some RowValue subclasses might need this. Defaults to None.

Raises:

ValueError – If the provided field is not an instance of the CountField class.

Variables:

  • field (CountField) – The associated CountField object.

  • raw_value (Optional[Any]) – The raw value as fetched/returned from the API.

upload_file_to_server(file_path: str | None = None, url: str | None = None, replace: bool = False) → List[Any]

Upload a file or files to Baserow either from a local path or by downloading it from a provided URL. The method either appends or replaces the current value based on the ‘replace’ flag.

Note: This function updates the in-memory representation of the row value. Use row.update() to save the updated value to the server.

Parameters:

  • file_path (Optional[str]) – Path to the file or directory to be uploaded. Defaults to None.

  • url (Optional[str]) – The URL of the file to download and upload. Defaults to None.

  • replace (bool) – If True, replaces the current value with the uploaded file’s data. Otherwise, appends. Defaults to False.

Returns:

A list of file object representations returned by Baserow.

Return type:

List[Any]

Raises:

  • ValueError – If neither file_path nor url is provided.

  • Exception – If there’s an error during the upload process.

class RowIterator(table: Table, initial_url: str, fetch_data_fn=None)

Bases: object

add_row(rows_data: Dict[str, Any] | List[Dict[str, Any]]) → Row | List[Row]

Add a new row (or multiple rows) to the table.

Parameters:

rows_data (dict or list[dict]) – A dictionary representing the fields and values of the row to add, or a list of dictionaries for adding multiple rows.

Returns:

An instance of the Row model representing the added row or a list of Row instances for multiple rows.

Return type:

Row or list[Row]

Raises:

Exception – If there’s any error during the API request.

delete_rows(rows_data: List[Row | int]) → bool

Deletes multiple rows from the table using the Baserow batch-delete endpoint.

This method accepts a list of Row objects or integers. For each item: - If it’s a Row object, the method extracts its ID for deletion. - If it’s an integer, it represents the ID of the row to be deleted.

Parameters:

rows_data (list[Union[Row, int]]) – A list of Row objects or integers. Row objects represent the rows to be deleted, while integers represent the row IDs to be deleted.

Returns:

True if rows are successfully deleted, otherwise an exception is raised.

Return type:

bool

Raises:

  • ValueError – If rows_data is empty or doesn’t provide valid row IDs.

  • TypeError – If an item in rows_data is neither an integer nor a Row object.

  • Exception – If the API request results in any error responses.

property field_names: List[str]

Retrieve the names of all fields in the table.

Returns:

List[str]: A list of field names.

Raises:

Exception: If there’s an error while fetching the field names.

property fields: FieldList

Retrieve the fields associated with the table.

If the fields haven’t been fetched yet, this property sends an API request to retrieve them. Once retrieved, the fields are cached to avoid unnecessary API requests in subsequent calls.

Returns:

A FieldList containing all the Field objects associated with this table.

Return type:

FieldList

Raises:

Exception – If there’s an unexpected error when fetching the fields.

get_row(row_id: int | str) → Row

Retrieve a specific row by its ID from the table.

Parameters:

row_id (int or str) – The unique identifier of the row to retrieve.

Returns:

An instance of the Row model representing the fetched row.

Return type:

Row

Raises:

  • ValueError – If the provided row_id is not valid.

  • Exception – If there’s any error during the API request or if the row is not found.

get_rows(include: List[str] | None = None, exclude: List[str] | None = None, search: str | None = None, order_by: List[str] | None = None, filter_type: str | None = None, filters: List[str] | None = None, view_id: int | None = None, page_size: int | None = None, return_single: bool = False, **kwargs) → Row | RowIterator

Retrieves rows from the table using provided parameters.

Parameters:

  • include (list, optional) – A list of field names to include in the results.

  • exclude (list, optional) – A list of field names to exclude from the results.

  • search (str, optional) – A search string to apply on the table data.

  • order_by (list, optional) – Field by which the results should be ordered.

  • filter_type (str, optional) – The type of filter to be applied.

  • filters (list, optional) – A list containing Filter objects to be applied.

  • view_id (int, optional) – ID of the view to consider its filters and sorts.

  • page_size (int, optional) – The number of rows per page in the response.

  • return_single (bool, optional) – If True, returns a single Row object instead of an iterator.

  • kwargs (dict) – Additional parameters for the API request.

Returns:

Depending on return_single, either a single Row object or a RowIterator.

Return type:

Union[Row, RowIterator]

Raises:

Exception – If any error occurs during the process.

property primary_field: str

Retrieve the primary field of the table.

If the primary field hasn’t been determined yet, this property will invoke the method to set it. Once set, the primary field is cached to avoid unnecessary computations in subsequent calls.

Returns:

The primary field of the table.

Return type:

str

update_rows(rows_data: List[Dict[str, Any] | Row]) → List[Row]

Updates multiple rows in the table using the Baserow batch update endpoint.

This method accepts a list of Row objects or dictionaries. For each item: - If it’s a dictionary, the method checks that all keys correspond to valid, editable fields in the table, validates the provided values, and ensures that an ‘id’ key is present with the row ID. - If it’s a Row object, the method extracts its values, excluding any that are read-only.

Parameters:

rows_data (list[Union[dict, Row]]) – A list of dictionaries or Row objects. Each dictionary should contain the field values for updating a specific row and include the ID of the row to be updated. Row objects represent the rows to be updated.

Returns:

A list of Row objects representing the updated rows.

Return type:

list[Row]

Raises:

  • ValueError – If rows_data is empty, trying to update a read-only field, or invalid ‘order’ value.

  • KeyError – If a dictionary contains a key that doesn’t correspond to any field in the table or is missing the ‘id’ key.

  • TypeError – If an item in rows_data is neither a dictionary nor a Row object.

  • Exception – If the API request results in any error responses.
